meanings.definition: To exchange something for something else.
meanings.sent1: She rechanged her toy for a different one.
meanings.sent2: He rechanged his book at the bookstore.
meanings.sent3: The kids rechanged their snacks with each other.
meanings.sent4: The clouds rechanged their shapes as the wind blew.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the leaves rechanged in the fall.

meanings.definition: To give something in exchange for something else.
meanings.sent1: They rechanged their tickets for better seats.
meanings.sent2: She rechanged her gift for a different one.
meanings.sent3: He rechanged his lunch with his friend's sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The river rechanged its course after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The students rechanged their pencils for markers.

meanings.definition: To replace something with something else.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic rechanged the old part with a new one.
meanings.sent2: She rechanged her broken phone for a new one.
meanings.sent3: He rechanged his worn-out shoes with a fresh pair.
meanings.sent4: The sun rechanged the darkness with light at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The chef rechanged the recipe to include healthier ingredients.
